intro: Chloanthes stoechadis, commonly known as the white-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on sandy or rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
